meanings.definition: Any of various hymenopteran insects of the family Tenthredinidae, the females of which have a sawlike ovipositor for inserting eggs into plant tissue.
meanings.sent1: The sawflies buzzed around the garden, looking for a place to lay their eggs.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of sawflies on the rose bush in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The sawflies seemed to be playing hide-and-seek among the leaves.
meanings.sent4: The sawflies' ovipositors were like tiny saws carefully carving into the plant.
meanings.sent5: The sawflies' buzzing sound filled the air as they worked diligently.

meanings.definition: The larvae of these insects, which resemble caterpillars and feed on plants.
meanings.sent1: The sawflies' larvae were munching on the leaves, leaving tiny holes behind.
meanings.sent2: The garden was overrun by sawflies, both adults and larvae.
meanings.sent3: The sawflies' larvae were having a feast, much to the dismay of the plants.
meanings.sent4: The sawflies' larvae moved in unison, devouring everything in their path.
meanings.sent5: The sawflies' larvae wriggled like tiny green caterpillars on the plant.
